questions.question: Azure AI Anomaly Detector supports both univariate and multivariate anomaly detection strategies.
Multivariate anomaly detection in Azure AI can analyze up to 500 signals simultaneously.
What is the main benefit of using univariate detection mode in Azure AI Anomaly Detector?
options: Focuses on detecting anomalies in a single time-series variable.
questions.answer: Focuses on detecting anomalies in a single time-series variable.

questions.question: Which feature allows Azure Anomaly Detector to handle real-time data streams efficiently?
When training models in multivariate detection, what is the recommended minimum number of data points per variable?
Explain how sensitivity settings in Azure AI Anomaly Detector can impact the detection results.
questions.answer: Higher sensitivity increases anomaly detection but may misinterpret minor deviations, while lower sensitivity reduces false positives but may miss smaller anomalies.

questions.question: Describe a real-world application of Azure AI's multivariate detection mode.
questions.answer: A real-world application includes predictive maintenance where data from multiple sensors (e.g., pressure, temperature) on machinery is analyzed to predict equipment failures.
